ie.gmit.sw

Class ExecuteQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.ExecuteQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ExecuteQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    ExecuteQuery class implements Runnable

    parse() -Get substrings of the queryText with kmers of size 2, 3 and 4. -Add the kmer and the query language to the database

    analyseQuery() -Break up the query into substrings of kmers of size 2, 3, 4 and converts the substring kmers into HashCodes -If the hashCode for the kmer exists, add 1 to the hashCodes frequency. If it does not, add the new hashCode with a frequency of 1 to the Map -Creats a temp List for storing the values in the Map. -Each first language entry in will be the highest ranking one then put into the sortMap Map. When rank reaches 300, break -Output the language in which the query appears to be written in

    run() -While keepRunning is true the run method will take from the head of the Blocking Queue. -If the query language is equal to "Finished" (This means the poison has been found), keepRunning will be set to false and the method will be finished -If the query language is not equal to "Finished", parse q
    Since:
    Oxygen.3a Release (4.7.3a)

      • analyseQuery

        public void analyseQuery(java.lang.String s)
        Creates two ConcurrentHashMaps. One for the query and one for sorting the Map. Nested for loop to break up the query into substrings of kmers of size 2, 3 and 4. Convert the substring kmers into HashCodes If the hashCode for the kmer exists, add 1 to the hashCodes frequency If the hashCode for the kmer does not exist, add the new hashCode with a frequency of 1 to the Map Create a temp List for storing the values in the Map. Each first language entry in will be the highest ranking one then put into the sortMap Map When rank reaches 300, break Output the language in which the query appears to be written in
        Parameters:
        s -

      • run

        public void run()
        While keepRunning is true the run method will take from the head of the Blocking Queue. If the query language is equal to "Finished" (This means the poison has been found), keepRunning will be set to false and the method will be finished If the query language is not equal to "Finished", parse q
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
